result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Wewasson, Carl J

records.addlTxt:
2:59 PM Defendant Carl J Wewasson in court, in custody Vilas County Jail. Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Carl J Wewasson.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Victim rights legislation has been complied with. Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State to e-file information in court and provide copies to defense.  Defense waives formal reading of information.  Not guilty pleas entered by court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 11:30 am.

9:30 AM Defendant Carl J Wewasson in court, in custody with the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Carl J Wewasson.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CF146 and 22CM181.  Defense speaks to the motion. State speaks to the motion. Court makes statement to the motion. Court denied motion for bond modification. Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:31 PM Defendant Carl J Wewasson appeared by video, in custody from the Vilas County Jail.  DA Karl Hayes appears in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jolin appears. Confirms receipt of criminal complaint on both cases. Attorney Jolin requesting to be heard on bond in 22CM181 and 22CF146. Bond modification hearing to be set at a different date/time.
Motion hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No contact with CTW (2009) and KA (1986).

2:35 PM Defendant appears by video from the Vilas County Jail without counsel.  DA Karl Hayes appears for the State of Wisconsin.  No complaint filed yet.  DA Hayes speaks to the incident that occurred that resulted in the defendant's arrest. Bond set at $25,000.00 Cash with condition: No contact with C.T.W.(2009) and K.A.(1986).  Bond form.
Hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
